how do give access to our dev to implement tracking

To give access to your developer for implementing tracking, you can follow these steps: 
1. Create an Ad Account if you haven't already. 
2. Request your API token by contacting adsupport@newsbreak.com with your Organization ID. 
3. Share the API token with your developer for integration.
For more detailed instructions, please refer to our API Integration Guide: [API Integration Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/27680147056397-API-Integration-Guide).
hello i need to block partner inventory , we just want to target Newsbreak. campaign performing bad even after 4k spend

Hi there! I understand you want to block partner inventory and target only Newsbreak. To do this, you can adjust your campaign settings in the Ad Manager. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to do it:
1. Log in to your Newsbreak Ad Manager account.
2. Go to the campaign you want to edit.
3. Navigate to the targeting options.
4. Look for the inventory sources section.
5. Deselect any third-party or partner inventory options, leaving only Newsbreak selected.
If you need more detailed instructions, please refer to this article: [Newsbreak Ads Overview](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/34188623183757-How-to-integrate-a-Newsbreak-Postback-with-CPV-One).
Let me know if you need any further assistance!
i dont see the option to block it, theres only 1 option that says newsbreak app preselected, no other option

Thanks for the clarification! If you only see the Newsbreak app preselected and no other options, it means your campaign is already targeting only Newsbreak inventory. However, if your campaign is still performing poorly, you might want to review other aspects such as ad creatives, targeting parameters, or budget allocation.
For further assistance on optimizing your campaign, please email our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com with details about your campaign performance and any specific issues you're facing. They can provide more tailored advice to help improve your results.
Let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with!
i emailed them over 6 times, and also did the webform 4 times. no response regarding that

I'm really sorry to hear that you haven't received a response yet. Let me help escalate this issue for you. I'll send an email to our support team on your behalf to ensure they address your concerns promptly.

I've escalated your issue to our support team and requested that they prioritize your case. You should receive a response soon. In the meantime, if there's anything else I can assist you with, please let me know!
thank you
You're welcome! If you have any other questions or need further assistance, feel free to reach out. Have a great day!
do you guys have manager accounts for agencies to manage multiple accounts?

Yes, we do offer manager accounts for agencies to manage multiple accounts. You can create separate ad accounts under one organization and manage them effectively. For more details on how to create and manage these accounts, you can refer to our Account Management Guide here: [Account Management Guide](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17539290349709-Account-Management-Guide).
how can we expedite ad approval

To expedite ad approval, make sure that your ads comply with all our advertising policies and guidelines. Double-check for any issues that might cause delays, such as inappropriate content or incorrect formatting. If your account is new and not yet verified, you can speed up the process by providing the following details via email to adsupport@newsbreak.com with the subject line: Business Verification –
- Company's full address
- Company's legal entity name
- Company's EHID or DUNS number
- Primary contact person's name
- Company's phone number
Once we receive this information, we will conduct a thorough review and update you on your account status. We appreciate your cooperation in maintaining a secure and compliant advertising environment for all our partners.
is there a way to make bulk edits to ad headline

Currently, NewsBreak does not support bulk edits to ad headlines directly within the platform. You will need to edit each ad individually. If you have any specific requirements or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to our support team at adsupport@newsbreak.com.
what are some best practices to get campaigns converting and scaling

To get your campaigns converting and scaling effectively, here are some best practices you can follow:
1. **Daily Budget**: Start with a small budget to let the system learn. It's recommended to set your daily budget around 10x your goal CPA.
2. **Event Standardization**: Ensure that events are consistently labeled across all tracking methods.
3. **Scaling**: When increasing your budget, do it in no more than 50% increments to keep performance stable while growing your reach.
4. **A/B Testing**: Use A/B testing to compare different versions of your ads and make data-driven decisions for continuous improvement.
For more detailed strategies, you can check out these articles:
- [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices)
- [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices)
- [Ad Creative Best Practices and A/B Testing](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20676690598029-Ad-Creative-Best-Practices-and-A-B-Testing)
how scaleable is newsbreak ads, is it possible to spend 20k per day?

NewsBreak ads can be quite scalable, and it is possible to spend $20k per day. However, it's important to scale your budget gradually to ensure optimal performance. Here are some tips for scaling effectively:
1. **Gradual Increases**: Increase your daily budget in no more than 50% increments every 2-3 days. This helps maintain performance stability while growing your reach.
2. **Learning Phase**: Ensure your campaign has enough data to optimize by allowing it to go through the learning phase, which typically takes about 20 to 30 conversions.
3. **Monitor Performance**: Keep an eye on key metrics and make adjustments as needed based on performance data.
For more detailed strategies on scaling, you can check out this article: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices)
i see other advertisers using ads that are more than 60 seconds long, but why am i limited to 60second max ad limit

The 60-second ad limit is a standard policy for NewsBreak ads to ensure that content remains engaging and effective for our audience. This limit helps maintain user attention and improves the overall performance of your ads. If you see other advertisers with longer ads, it might be due to specific exceptions or different ad formats that are not generally available. For more details on ad policies and guidelines, you can refer to our [Ad Policies](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/20624355375117-Ad-Policies).
how do i get an exception like them, we are big advertisers

Currently, NewsBreak maintains a 60-second limit for video ads to ensure optimal engagement and performance. Exceptions to this rule are rare and typically reserved for special cases or partnerships. If you believe your campaign would benefit significantly from longer ads, I recommend reaching out directly to our ad support team to discuss your specific needs and explore potential options. You can email them at adsupport@newsbreak.com with details about your request.
why is my cpc $10

Hey there! The minimum budget requirement to run ads on our platform is $10, which means that when you set up an ad campaign, you will need to allocate a budget of at least $10. This ensures that advertisers can reach a reasonable audience size and have a meaningful impact on their advertising objectives. For more details, you can check out this article: [NewsBreak Advertising Cost](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/17959734533005-NewsBreak-Advertising-Cost).
why is my cpc so high

Hi there! The cost per click (CPC) can vary based on several factors, including the competitiveness of your target audience, the quality of your ad creatives, and your bid strategy. To help manage and potentially lower your CPC, you might want to review and optimize your targeting settings, improve your ad creatives, and ensure that your bid is set at a level that aligns with your business goals. For more tips on maximizing the value of your ad budget, you can check out this article: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
my cpc is too high

I understand that a high CPC can be frustrating. Here are a few strategies you can try to lower your CPC:
1. **Optimize Your Target Audience**: Narrow down your audience to target more specific groups who are more likely to engage with your ad.
2. **Improve Ad Creatives**: Enhance the quality and relevance of your ad creatives to increase engagement and click-through rates (CTR).
3. **Adjust Your Bid Strategy**: Review and adjust your bid amounts to ensure they align with your campaign goals without overspending.
4. **Use the Bid Estimation Tool**: This tool can help you identify ad sets with high growth potential and project conversion, cost, and impression metrics based on bid adjustments.
For more detailed best practices, you can refer to this article: [Maximize Conversions Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/23055076590221-Maximize-Conversions-Best-Practices).
where is bid estimation tool

The bid estimation tool can be found when you edit tCPA ad sets that are labeled as 'Learning Phase Complete.' This tool helps identify ad sets with high growth potential and projects conversion, cost, and impression metrics based on how much you increase your bid rate. For more details, you can check out this article: [tCPA Best Practices](https://help.newsbreak.com/hc/en-us/articles/18020232662797-tCPA-Best-Practices).
